block.p: Gordon Edges Closer to Winston Cup Title
Ricky Rudd won the race yesterday and Dale Earnhardt barely kept alive his Winston Cup championship battle with Jeff Gordon in the Dura-Lube 500k at Phoenix International Raceway.

While Rudd earned his 16th career victory, Earnhardt cut into Gordon's point lead for the third straight race, slicing the margin to 147 with only the season-ending race Nov. 12 at Atlanta left. Gordon would only need only to finish anywhere except last at Atlanta to win the title. (AP)
SCHUMACHER WINS: Michael Schumacher raced to his ninth victory of the season yesterday in the Japanese Grand Prix, tying Nigel Mansell's 1992 Formula One record. (AP)

Thomas Muster beat MaliVai Washington, 7-6 (8-6), 2-6, 6-3, 6-4, yesterday to win the Eurocard Open in Essen, Germany, for his 12th title of 1995. The Austrian, ranked No. 3 in the world, got $315,000 for the first indoor title of his career. (AP)

Meg Mallon fired a seven-under-par 65 yesterday, helping United States players from the Ladies Professional Golf Association come from behind for a 19-17 victory over Japanin the Nichirei International tournament in Ina, Japan. (AP)

David Green of the Australian equestrian team, with a score of 55.2, was the overall winner aboard Chatsby at the United States equestrian team's three-day event at the Fair Hill (Md.) Festival yesterday. David J. O'Connor of The Plains, Va., and his mount, Giltedge, posted the best American finish, a score of 55.4.
